actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code to permit foreign pension plans to invest in the United States on a nontaxable basis.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to grant tax-exempt status to a trust, corporation, or fund formed by a foreign segregated asset pension plan maintained primarily for the benefit of nonresident alien employees. Requires, as a condition for such tax-exemption, that the pension plan be eligible for preferential tax treatment in the foreign country in which it is maintained.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code to permit foreign pension plans to invest in the United States on a nontaxable basis.
